pub.citation: Muller, K. and T. Borsch. 2005. Phylogenetics of Amaranthaceae Based on matK/trnK Sequence Data: Evidence from Parsimony, Likelihood, and Bayesian Analyses. Annals of the Missouri Botanical Garden 92: 66-102

pmmd.notes: Figure 1 (pages 80-81). Strict consensus tree from the parsimony analyses both with and without illelusion of coded indels (without indels: 5360 steps, CI = 0.487, RI = 0.656, RC = 0.320; with indels: 5574 steps, CI = 0.501, RI = 0.664, RC = ().333). Bootstrap values are given above branches, and Bremer support below branches (left number = without indels, right number = including indel characters). a (page 80). Section of the tree fotusing on Chenopo- diaceae, closely related Caryophyllales, and outgroup. The classification of Chenopodiaceae follows Kuhn et al. (1993) and Kadereit c-t a1. (2003). p.p. = pro parte. b (page 81). Section of the tree focusing on Amaranthaceae; the clas- sification follows Townsend (1993). P = Pseudoplantageae; Gomph = Gomphreninae; Froel = Froelichiinae. From left to right, subtribes, tribes, and subfamilies are indicated.
